item.title: Pylon lands $17M investment to build a full service B2B customer service platform

item.description:

item.title: Polaris Dawn will push the limits of SpaceX’s human spaceflight program — here’s how to watch it launch live
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Update 8/27: The Polaris Dawn launch has been pushed back a day and is now planned for Wednesday, August 28 after a helium leak was detected ahead of its takeoff. item.title: Calm’s new Story-like mindfulness exercises offer an alternative to social media
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
Calm is rolling out a suite of new features to make it easier for people to fit mindfulness into their lives. Most notably, the app is launching “Taptivities,” which are interactive text-based stories that take a minute or two to complete. The app is also adding Playlists and personalized search. item.title: Fast-growing immigrant-focused neobank Comun has secured $21.5M in new funding just months after its last raise

item.description:
Comun, a digital bank focused on serving immigrants in the United States, has raised $21.5 million in a Series A funding round less than nine months after announcing a $4.5 million raise, TechCrunch is the first to report. This is a crowded space, filled with a number of startups, including Tanda, Bloom Money, Majority, Welcome […]

item.title: Brave lays off 27 employees
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Web browser and search startup Brave has laid off 27 employees across the different departments, TechCrunch has learned. The company confirmed the layoffs but didn’t give more details about the total headcount left nor the reason for the layoffs. PitchBook however estimates that Brave has around 191 employees, working out to Brave cutting 14% of […]

item.title: Zepto, snagging $1 billion in 90 days, projects 150% annual growth
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Zepto co-founder Aadit Palicha told a group of analysts and investors on Tuesday that the three-year-old Indian delivery startup anticipates growth of 150% in the next 12 months, a remarkable figure suggesting the fast-growing quick commerce market in India is showing no signs of slowing down. Palicha shared these insights during a call organized by […]

item.title: India’s VerSe buys Valueleaf to boost digital marketing

item.title: One busted valve led to the failure of Astrobotic’s $108M Peregrine lunar lander mission
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Astrobotic’s Peregrine lunar lander failed to reach the moon because of a problem with a single valve in the propulsion system, according to a report on the mission released Tuesday. Company leadership said in a press conference that engineers have redesigned the valve and introduced additional redundancy into the propulsion system of its next lander, […]

item.title: Meta and Instagram spotted developing a new social music-sharing feature
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Meta and Spotify are exploring deeper music integration in Meta’s Instagram app. New findings indicate the companies are testing a feature that would allow users to continuously share what music they’re listening to through Instagram’s Notes. The new functionality was first spotted by reverse engineer Alessandro Paluzzi, who often finds unreleased features while they’re still […]

item.title: How Techstars, Meta helped profitable LatAm startup Mercately raise a $2.6M seed

item.description:

item.title: Why AI can’t spell ‘strawberry’
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
How many times does the letter “r” appear in the word “strawberry”? According to formidable AI products like GPT-4o and Claude, the answer is twice. Large language models (LLMs) can write essays and solve equations in seconds. They can synthesize terabytes of data faster than humans can open up a book. Yet, these seemingly omniscient […]

item.title: Lyft follows in Uber’s footsteps with a rider verification program
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
In an effort to improve its security measures, Lyft announced Tuesday a new rider verification pilot program to help drivers verify riders’ identities and ensure that they are indeed who they say they are.  Starting today, Lyft’s new program is rolling out to nine markets, including Atlanta, Chicago, Denver, Detroit, Houston, Jacksonville, Miami, Phoenix and Seattle. item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft is returning home empty
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams are stuck aboard the International Space Station (ISS) after their test flight on Boeing’s Starliner went awry. This weekend, NASA announced that these astronauts will remain aboard the ISS until February, when SpaceX’s Dragon will retrieve them as part of the Crew-9 mission. Eight months is a long time […]
